examples: special arrangements were available for the aged

definitions.text: begin to seem older; get older
examples: The death of his wife caused him to age fast
we age every day--what a depressing thought!
The death of his child aged him tremendously

definitions.text: advanced in years; (`aged' is pronounced as two syllables)
examples: elderly residents could remember the construction of the first skyscraper

definitions.text: at an advanced stage of erosion (pronounced as one syllable)
having attained a specific age; (`aged' is pronounced as one syllable)
of wines, fruit, cheeses; having reached a desired or final condition; (`aged' pronounced as one syllable)
(used of tobacco) aging as a preservative process (`aged' is pronounced as one syllable)
